result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Michael McCarrier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Emergency Rescue Worker, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(7)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA related DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid during term of Extended supervision.  Nonpayment peanlty shall result in  a civil judgment.
Court costs and victim witness surcharge waived as defendant is indigent and this will cause a significant financial burden on the defendant. Bail to be returned to poster.  Bail not to apply.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two; consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for six (6) days.

superMiscConds.notes: Cooperate/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendasnt ohave aprt time job, if defendant is in school part time defendant to have a full time job.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: count one; consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for six (6) days.

records.addlTxt: Order to Produce, received and filed.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Curtis Michael McCarrier in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Curtis McCarrier in custody.   Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to both counts and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty on both counts as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements from State, Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, concurrent with COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 6 days time served. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges WAIVED as defendant is indigent and this will cause a significant financial burden on the defendant. 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job 
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, concurrent with COUNT 1,  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 6 days time served. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges WAIVED as defendant is indigent and this will cause a significant financial burden on the defendant. 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job 
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court ordered any cash bail on deposit be returned to person who posted.  No fees, costs, assessments for forfeitures to be taken out of any bail on deposit. 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon  may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Curtis Michael McCarrier in court with attorney Christopher Hartley (for attorney Mark A. Pecora).  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Parties engaged in negotiations for global resolution.  WCS Report reviewed with the parties; no action requested from the state.  Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Curtis Michael McCarrier in court with attorney Christina Balistreri for Mark A. Pecora.  Ron Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Stayed Bench Warrant is withdrawn. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21. Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Report received and filed.

Attorney Chris Hartley for Mark A. Pecora in court.  Ron Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel informs the Court that the defendant is still under medical care, not able to appear.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
